pull.title: qt: Fixing division by zero in time remaining
pull.body:
Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/10291, https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/11265

progressDelta may be 0 (or even negative according to 11265), this checks for that and prints unknown if it is, because we cannot calculate an estimate for the time remaining (would be infinite or negative).

rename.from: Fixing division by zero in time remaining
rename.to: qt: Fixing division by zero in time remaining

events.message: Fix division by zero in time remaining
Refactor tipUpdate as per style guide

issue.title: unclear GUI message in sychronize screen if progress increase is negative (QT)
issue.body:
in the GUI, that dark synchronise screen, if "Progress increase per hour" goes negative, then "Estimated time left until synced" says "%n left", not integers, but '%n'. I was expecting a meaningful wording, like "unknown" or "infinity".

## can you reproduce the problem?
I get this behavour by suspending a non-synced node for a few hours and then restoring it.

### What version of bitcoin-core are you using?
0.15.99

## machine:
Atom 330, 2GB RAM, 5400 RPM HDD, GNU/Linux

issue.title: Backport Bitcoin Qt/Gui changes up to 0.14.x part 3
issue.body:
This is the third part of Qt/Gui related PRs being backported from Bitcoin to Dash.

I tried to stick with modal overlay related PRs, but also included some PRs which contain changes later touched by the overlay related PRs.

This PR also includes parts of the network activity toggle I mentioned [here](https://github.com/dashpay/dash/pull/1615#issuecomment-328062535). I added a commit on top of that PR to revert the functionality of the network status icon, so that it keeps opening the peers list instead of toggling network state. This means, that for now it's only possible to toggle network status with the new RPC call setnetworkactive. Later we may add a context menu to the status icon which gives an option to toggle network status. At that point we should probably also replace the network disabled icon to something that fits to the style of the Dash network status.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9218 also introduced the ClickableLabel which was then used for the network toggle and the sync spinner icon. While reverting the changes to the network status icon, I decided to also use the ClickableLabel for the status icon (removes the QPushButton flat button + style handling, making future backporting easier).

With this backport PR merged, we have all the functionality of the modal overlay from Bitcoin 0.14. The remaining backports that I'll do are not related to the overlay, and thus can be postponed to later (after the next releast).

issue.title: 0.15.1: Backports
issue.body:
This mostly backports various commits that fix(ed) bugs and issues.

However, it also includes two patches for qt that only fix minor issues,
as well as some doc patches.

comments.body: Please don't combine refactoring (code style fixups) and a bugfix in one commit. This makes it extremely hard to review what is changed. If you want to do this in one PR, that's okay, but please do it as two separate commits.

Did you remove this comment intentionally?
Edit: oh! it's re-added in the commit after this. That's a bit strange :)
Ah must have just been a bad commit split, sorry about that
